Extensions
Extensions are a tool that allows one object type to be supplemented with attributes of another type. This helps synchronize attribute sets between different objects, even if they are not within the same hierarchy.
Use examples:
a decision request can include data from a client form;
a collateral conclusion can contain attributes of a collateral object.
Working with extensions is performed in the object type settings on the "Extensions" tab, which is divided into two sections:
"Extensions"
— for adding main extensions;
"Possible extensions"
— for working with potential extensions.
To add an extension, click the
button in the corresponding section and, in the window that appears, select an object type that will serve as a source of attributes (the extending type):
Using parent or child types as extensions is
not allowed
.
The full list of types in the parameter drop-down list becomes available after clicking the "Show all types" button
, which is displayed if the "Run" permission for the
"View system types in the "Object type" registry"
is granted.
After selecting the extending type, click the "OK" button, then save the profile of the current object type.
As a result of the configuration, working with attributes of the extending type becomes available:
on the object visual
: the placement method of extending type attributes on the visual depends on the extension type (
main
or
possible
);
in the profile of the extended type
: the list of attributes of the extending type becomes available on the
"Attributes"
tab when the "Show parent attributes" option is enabled;
For attributes added via
main extensions
,
overriding
parameters relative to the original values is available.
Whereas modification of attributes added via
possible extensions
is available only from the extending type profile.
in the registry of the extended type
: when
configuring columns
of the registry of the extended type, the "Show parent attributes" option must be enabled to display attributes of the extending type;
in algorithms
: to access values of attributes of the extending type in algorithms, the
attr
function is used.
When the attribute set of the extending type changes, all changes are automatically reflected in the extended type as well.
Main extensions
The main extension automatically adds all attributes from the selected (extending) object type to the current (extended) type.
Attribute placement on the visual
Adding additional attributes is performed in the
instance visual editing
mode of the current type. On the "Elements" panel, go to the "Attributes" tab, enable the "Show parent attributes" option, and drag and drop the required attribute from the list into the profile workspace.
Working with attributes
Further work with additional attributes is performed
in a standard way
.
Possible extensions
A possible (potential) extension is an
optional
set of attributes that the user can manually add to a specific object type instance when necessary.
When a possible extension is added to an object, the System automatically creates a new instance of the extending type and relates it with the original object. As a result, the data is stored in the table of the extending type rather than in the main table of the extended object, which helps optimize the database structure.
Possible extensions are managed using the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Mandatory selection of a possible extension
Defining whether at least one extension from the list must be selected before saving an object instance.
The default value is "No".
Selecting multiple extensions in the same instance
Controlling whether one or multiple extensions can be selected for a single object instance.
The default value is "No".
Hide the Extension button in the object profile
Controlling the visibility of the extension selection button.
The default value is "No".
Attribute placement on the visual
Adding additional attributes is performed in the
instance visual editing
mode of the current type. On the "Elements" panel, go to the "Layout" tab and drag and drop the "Extension"
grouping element
into the profile workspace.
Next, in the "Extension type" and "Visual" fields, select the corresponding extending type added
earlier
in the "Possible extensions" section, as well as the visual required for display.
Working with attributes
In the control panel of the extended type object, the "Extensions" button is displayed. Clicking it opens a modal window with the list of possible extensions:
After selecting an extension, attributes are added to the extended type in accordance with the previously selected visual of the extending type.
Key differences
A comparison of the functionality of main and possible extensions is presented in the table below.
Characteristic
Main extension
Possible extension
Application
Automatically to all instances of the type
Manually to individual instances by selection
Data storage
In the table of the extended type
In the table of the extending type
Attribute configuration
Parameters can be overridden in the extended type
Cannot be overridden; settings of the original type are used
Main purpose
Permanent extension of type functionality
Flexible, situation-aware of specific instances
